feed.title: MSFS Blog
feed.subtitle: Development updates of Microsoft Flight Simulator.

entry.title: Anniversary Creator Highlight – Simulation Daily
entry.summary: Born from over 25 years of experience in gaming journalism, we’re focusing on Simulation Daily and Editor-in-Chief Giuseppe Nelva for our Anniversary Creator Highlight. Whilst Simulation Daily is a fairly new website in the landscape of flight sim journalism, having only published its first article in July 2024, the website aims to cover all aspects … Continued

entry.title: Creator Highlight – Japanese Screenshot Challenge Community
entry.summary: Screenshot from Japanese simmer and X (formerly Twitter) user @ukaka5656.Every week in our Development Update blog, the MSFS Team challenges the community to capture their best screenshots that fit the new weekly theme. We are continually amazed by the dedication of the Screenshot Challenge participants as they showcase beautiful and creative images of aircraft and … Continued

entry.title: October 2nd, 2025 Development Update
entry.summary: This week’s Screenshot Challenge winner is X user vp_sim! If you’re interested in participating in our weekly Screenshot Challenges, check out the details in the Community section below.Following last week’s announcement that Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 is coming to Sony PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 5 Pro consoles this December, applications to join the upcoming public beta … Continued

entry.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 Soars Onto PlayStation 5
entry.summary: Experience an unprecedented level of aviation realism and authenticity starting December 8th.

entry.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator Releases World Update 20: Japan
entry.summary: This massive, exciting update brings Japan to life like never before in Microsoft Flight Simulator! Japan is a nation of beauty and intrigue, filled with breathtaking vistas of towering mountains, iconic architecture, and renowned cities. The country beholds some of the world’s most alluring and famous sights, including Mount Fuji, Japan’s highest mountain, Osaka Castle, a … Continued

entry.title: Microsoft Flight Simulator Releases Local Legend 22: The NAMC YS-11
entry.summary: Fly the only post-World War II commercial airliner designed and manufactured entirely within Japan!Rise of an Innovative, Powerful TurbopropThe YS-11 is a twin-turboprop regional airliner that was developed and produced by Japanese aviation consortium Nihon Aircraft Manufacturing Corporation (NAMC). The story of the YS-11 began in the wake of the Second World War in the … Continued
